para.text: This function aim to check the tripping voltage value of under-voltage protection.

In the Under-voltage test, the start voltage is required to be greater than the action voltage of the protection setting. Usually "start voltage" we set as nominal voltage, "stop voltage" set as less than the action voltage of the protection relay to ensure the protection relay can met the trip conditions.

para.text: Defined all the analog outputs magnitudes and phase angles. make the protection relay work properly.

para.text: Duration of prefault state, using the output config with nominal frequency.

para.text: Maximum time of fault state automatically calculated by module.

para.text: An stable state after the variable slipped if no tripping met.

text.style: font-family:Verdana; font-size:12pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Defined the initial voltage on each steps start. Usually is set to Vnom.
Defined the ramping step voltage value from start voltage to destination voltage. Reduce this value can increase the accuracy of test result.
Defined the destination voltage value; Usually this value should ensure the protection relay can trip.
Defined the slip from start voltage to currently stop voltage. Usually this value should less than the dv/dt latch value of protection relay.
